titles.title: To authorize former Federal employees who receive voluntary separation incentive payments under the Department of Agriculture program to accept subsequent employment with the Federal Government, without loss of their payments, when such employment is directly related to fighting forest fires.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Government Reform, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

committee.subcommittee: Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 1/27/2003--Introduced. Amends the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1997 to authorize former Federal employees who receive Department of Agriculture voluntary separation incentive payments to accept subsequent Federal employment without loss of their payments when such employment is directly related to fighting forest fires.
